refsection.title: Description
refsection.para:
A bibliography. A DocBook bibliography may contain some introductory information, but its main content is a set of bibliography entries
(bibliomixed elements in Simplified DocBook).
(either biblioentry or bibliomixed). These may occur directly inside the bibliography element or inside bibliodiv elements.

refsection.title: Processing expectations
refsection.para: Formatted as a displayed block. A bibliography in a book frequently causes a forced page break in print media.
Some systems may display only those entries within a bibliography that are cited in the containing document. This may be an interchange issue. See .

The two styles of bibliography entry have quite different processing expectations. A biblioentry is raw; it contains a database-like collection of named fields. A bibliomixed entry is cooked; the fields occur in the order in which they will be presented and additional punctuation may be sprinkled between the fields.
See biblioentry and bibliomixed for further discussion.
